concept.title: Testing and publishing on your server

shortdesc.ph: The testing and publishing tools provides runtime environments where you can test JSP files, servlets, HTML files,
Java classes and many more artifacts.

conbody.p: You can use the workbench to test and publish resources from many types of projects, here are examples:

ul.li: Dynamic Web projects, which typically contain JSP files, HTML files, servlets, and JavaBeans
Static Web projects, which typically contain HTML files and graphic files
Enterprise Applications projects, which may contain Java Archive (JAR) files or Web Archive (WAR) files or both, and pointers to other Web or EJB projects
EJB projects, which contain enterprise beans

conbody.p: After testing your application, you can use the tools to publish the application.

section.title: Server definitions
section.p: The workbench defines servers to test and publish your projects. Servers are definitions that identify where you want to test your projects. You can either have the development environment create the servers automatically for you, or you can create them using the New Server wizard (right-click in the Servers view and select NewServer ).
